oai_dc:dc.dc:title: French. Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 05 d
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 05 d. Newspaper clipping, fragment. Re: smoking abatement. (See also Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 05 c ).
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Politics & government; Clippings; Scrapbooks; Women; Smoke; Pollution;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This organization has been working on a plan or plans for several weeks, looking to the making of a smokeless city of Knoxville, and urges upon all women and men in the city the necessity of their co-operation and assistance in this matter. At the other mass meetings called by this organization, the at- endance has not been large, and Mrs. L. Crozier French, president of the league, is making a special ap- peal for the support of meeting on [to]morrow afternoon.
